Package space.sunqian.fs.base.bytes

Class BytesKit

java.lang.Object
space.sunqian.fs.base.bytes.BytesKit
public class BytesKit extends Object
Utilities for byte and byte array.

    • bytesToInt

      public static int bytesToInt(byte @Nonnull [] bytes)
      Converts the given byte array to an int value in big endian, and the least significant byte is the last byte of the array. Let n be bytes.length - 1, the int will be: byte[n-3], byte[n-2], byte[n-1], byte[n]. If the bytes is not enough, padding 0 into the missing bytes.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the given byte array
      Returns:
      the converted int value

    • bytesToInt

      public static int bytesToInt(byte @Nonnull [] bytes, int leastIndex) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Converts the given byte array to an int value in big endian, and the least significant byte is specified by the leastIndex. Let n be the index of the least significant byte, the int will be: byte[n-3], byte[n-2], byte[n-1], byte[n]. If the bytes is not enough, padding 0 into the missing bytes.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the given byte array
      leastIndex - the index of the least significant byte
      Returns:
      the converted int value
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the leastIndex is out of bounds

    • bytesToLong

      public static long bytesToLong(byte @Nonnull [] bytes)
      Converts the given byte array to a long value in big endian, and the least significant byte is the last byte of the array. Let n be bytes.length - 1, the long will be: byte[n-7], byte[n-6], byte[n-5], byte[n-4], byte[n-3], byte[n-2], byte[n-1], byte[n]. If the bytes is not enough, padding 0 into the missing bytes.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the given byte array
      Returns:
      the converted long value

    • bytesToLong

      public static long bytesToLong(byte @Nonnull [] bytes, int leastIndex) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Converts the given byte array to a long value in big endian, and the least significant byte is specified by the leastIndex. Let n be the index of the least significant byte, the long will be: byte[n-7], byte[n-6], byte[n-5], byte[n-4], byte[n-3], byte[n-2], byte[n-1], byte[n]. If the bytes is not enough, padding 0 into the missing bytes.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the given byte array
      leastIndex - the index of the least significant byte
      Returns:
      the converted long value
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the leastIndex is out of bounds

    • intToBytes

      public static byte @Nonnull [] intToBytes(int value)
      Converts the given int value to a byte array in big endian like: 
      
 return new byte[]{
     (byte) (value >>> 24),
     (byte) (value >>> 16),
     (byte) (value >>> 8),
     (byte) value
 };
      Parameters:
      value - the given int value
      Returns:
      the converted byte array

    • longToBytes

      public static byte @Nonnull [] longToBytes(long value)
      Converts the given long value to a byte array in big endian like: 
      
 return new byte[]{
     (byte) (value >>> 56),
     (byte) (value >>> 48),
     (byte) (value >>> 40),
     (byte) (value >>> 32),
     (byte) (value >>> 24),
     (byte) (value >>> 16),
     (byte) (value >>> 8),
     (byte) value
 };
      Parameters:
      value - the given long value
      Returns:
      the converted byte array
